alert.note: Alert for Chester; Montgomery; Philadelphia (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 19 at 2:52AM EST until December 19 at 9:00AM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Pennsylvania... Schuylkill River At Norristown affecting Philadelphia, Chester and Montgomery Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Schuylkill River at Norristown. * WHEN...Until late this morning. * IMPACTS...At 12.5 feet, Flooding occurs in West Norriton. The West Indian Lane bridge begins to flood. At 13.0 feet, Water begins to cover and close Riverview Boulevard in West Norriton. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:30 AM EST Tuesday the stage was 13.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 2:30 AM EST Tuesday was 15.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage early this morning and continue falling to 9.7 feet early Friday morning. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 13.3 feet on 01/26/2020. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (1 am) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Wed Thu Stg Time Date Schuylkill River Norristown 13.0 13.3 Tue 2 am 11.0 10.2 MSG unknown &&
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued this morning at 900 AM EST.
